definition: to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to do/to manage/to handle/to go about/to run/to set up/to deal with

sentences.english: My work for the paper has brought about a desirable situation in my everyday affairs.
sentences.chinese: 参与办报的工作给我的日常生活带来了好的变化。

sentences.english: It's got more than a century experience and prestige .
sentences.chinese: 它有一个世纪左右有办报经验和威望。

sentences.english: Registration starts today for daiwan's national assembly .
sentences.chinese: 今阿日国民大会开始办报到耶手续。

sentences.english: We must not run a newspaper behind closed doors.
Newspaper school refers to the different type of ideology and style in running a newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 报纸流派是指办报思想与办报风格的不同类型。

sentences.english: Newspaper school refers to the different type of ideology and style in running a newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 报纸流派是指办报思想与办报风格的不同类型。

sentences.english: And what is the relationship between running newspaper by politicians and entrepreneur management?
sentences.chinese: “政治家办报”与“企业家经营”有何关系？

definition: Shao Piaoping (1884-1926), pioneer of journalism and founder of newspaper Beijing Press 京報|京报, executed in 1926 by warlord Zhang Zuolin 張作霖|张作霖
Free China (Cold War era term for the Republic of China on Taiwan, as distinct from "Red China")
Dagong Bao, popular newspaper name/Ta Kung Pao, newspaper founded 1902 in Beijing, now published in Hong Kong
to start publishing/to found a journal
Zou Taofen (1895-1944), journalist, political theorist and publisher
scholarship/high-level study/to do scholarly research/to pursue a high level of study
to save from extinction/to save the nation
